[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Future Combinator Bugs] Can bugs in futures::future::FutureExt::map() cause incorrect permit drop timing? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Stream Combinator Bugs] Are there known issues with flat_map_unordered that could cause memory leaks or panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Async Task Spawning Order] Can the order in which spawn() calls complete differ from submission order, causing issues in sequential operations that require ordering? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Permit Acquisition Fairness] Is permit acquisition fair across different priority levels of tasks, or can low-priority tasks monopolize the executor? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Spawn vs Try_spawn Priority] Do spawn() and try_spawn() compete fairly for permits, or does one get priority over the other? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Concurrent Modification] Can the executor capacity be modified after creation, and if so, does this cause race conditions with pending spawn operations? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Function: concurrent_map()] [Stream Item Loss] Can items be lost if the stream is cancelled or errors occur during concurrent processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Function: concurrent_map()] [Duplicate Processing] Can stream items be processed multiple times if flat_map_unordered retries failed items? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Function: concurrent_map()] [Error Recovery] When a spawned task fails, does concurrent_map() have any error recovery mechanism, or does the entire stream fail? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Function: concurrent_map()] [Progress Guarantees] Can concurrent_map() make progress when all permits are exhausted, or does it deadlock? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Function: concurrent_map()] [Memory Amplification] Can processing a small stream create a large number of intermediate futures, causing memory amplification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Byzantine Validator] Can a Byzantine validator intentionally spawn malicious long-running tasks to exhaust BoundedExecutor capacity and degrade network performance? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Resource Monopolization] Can an attacker control task spawning to monopolize executor permits during critical consensus phases, causing missed block proposals? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Timing Attacks] Can precise timing of spawn() calls reveal information about internal validator state or consensus phases? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Capacity Inference] Can an external observer infer the configured executor capacity by analyzing task acceptance rates, revealing validator configuration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Task Completion Order] Can out-of-order task completion cause state inconsistencies when processing ordered operations like sequential transactions? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Partial Failure] If some tasks in a batch fail while others succeed, can this cause inconsistent state across validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Rollback Handling] If tasks need to be rolled back, does the executor provide any mechanism to coordinate rollbacks across multiple tasks? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Future Lifetime] Do the 'static lifetime requirements prevent spawning futures that borrow from the caller's stack? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Permit Lifetime] Can OwnedSemaphorePermit outlive the Semaphore it was created from, causing dangling references? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Closure Capture] Can closures passed to spawn_blocking capture references that outlive the blocking task, causing use-after-free? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Signal Safety] If a validator node receives SIGTERM during task execution, are permits properly released before process termination? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Interrupt Handling] Can Ctrl+C or other interrupts leave the executor in an inconsistent state with leaked permits? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Permit Metrics] Does BoundedExecutor expose metrics for current permit usage and capacity, allowing monitoring for capacity exhaustion attacks? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/bounded-executor/src/lib.rs] [Task Duration Metrics] Are there metrics for task execution duration to detect abnormally long-running tasks that might indicate attacks? (Low)
